header.title: Manager Functional Description

section.title: Features
section.p: The manager provided with the tool is a lightweight manager that provides a means to communicate with agents.
It does not implement any management capabilities by itself. That is up to the user.
A user in this context is a module implementing the snmpm_user behavior. A user can issue SNMP requests and receive notification/traps.
Agents to be accessed by the manager must be registered by a user. Once registered, they can be accessed by all registered users.
Notifications/traps from an agent is delivered to the user that did the registration.
Any message from an agent that is not registered is delivered to the default user.

By default, the default user is set to the snmpm_user_default module, which simply sends an information message to the error_logger. It is however highly recommended that this module is replaced by another that does something useful (for more information, see section
Configuring the Application).
When using SNMPv3, then (at least one) usm user must be registered.
